Easy Burrito

Jump to Recipe

Burritos are a beloved staple in Mexican cuisine, celebrated for their versatility and the explosion of flavors they offer in every bite. This easy burrito recipe is perfect for busy weeknights or casual gatherings, allowing you to customize each burrito with your favorite ingredients. With just a few simple components—like soft tortillas, hearty black beans, and zesty salsa—you can create a satisfying meal that caters to both vegetarians and meat lovers alike. Whether you choose to add succulent chicken or beef, or keep it plant-based with just beans and cheese, this recipe is adaptable to any palate. Plus, it’s a fantastic way to use up leftovers! In this article, we’ll guide you step-by-step through the process of making these delicious burritos, ensuring that they are not only easy to prepare but also packed with flavor. Let’s dive into the world of burritos and discover how you can whip up this delightful dish in no time!

Ingredients

tortilla

Use flour tortillas for a soft and pliable burrito or corn tortillas for a gluten-free option. If you don’t have tortillas, large lettuce leaves can be a low-carb alternative. To enhance flavor, consider lightly toasting the tortillas in a skillet before filling.

canned black beans

Rinse and drain the beans to remove excess sodium and improve flavor. You can substitute with pinto beans or kidney beans if desired. For added depth, sauté the beans with garlic, onion, and spices such as cumin or chili powder before mixing them into the burrito.

shredded cheese

Use a blend of cheeses like Monterey Jack and Cheddar for a richer flavor. If you want to reduce fat or calories, consider using low-fat cheese or omit the cheese entirely and use nutritional yeast for a cheesy flavor without dairy.

cooked chicken or beef (optional)

If using chicken, opt for shredded rotisserie chicken for convenience. For beef, ground beef seasoned with taco spices works great. You can replace meat with sautéed vegetables like bell peppers and onions for a vegetarian option.

salsa

Choose a salsa that matches your preferred spice level. Fresh pico de gallo can elevate the flavor profile. If you want to make your own, combine diced tomatoes, onions, cilantro, lime juice, and jalapeños. For a smoky flavor, consider adding chipotle salsa.

sour cream (optional)

Greek yogurt can be a healthier substitute for sour cream, providing a similar creaminess with added protein. To enhance flavor, mix in some lime juice or cilantro. If you want a dairy-free option, use cashew cream or avocado crema.

lettuce (optional)

Use romaine or iceberg lettuce for crunch. If you want to add more flavor, consider adding shredded cabbage or arugula. For a more nutrient-dense option, try baby spinach.

avocado (optional)

Choose ripe avocados for the best flavor and texture. If you don't have fresh avocados, guacamole can be a great substitute. For added flavor, sprinkle lime juice and salt on the avocado slices to prevent browning and enhance taste.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Warm the tortillas

    In a skillet over low heat, warm the tortillas for about 30 seconds on each side until soft. This step is crucial as it makes the tortillas pliable for folding. If you have a microwave, you can also wrap the tortillas in a damp paper towel and heat them for about 20 seconds.

  • Step 2: Prepare the filling

    In a mixing bowl, combine the canned black beans (drained and rinsed), shredded cheese, and any additional protein you like (cooked chicken or beef). Stir until well mixed. For added flavor, consider seasoning the beans with salt, pepper, or a dash of cumin.

  • Step 3: Assemble the burrito

    Spoon the prepared bean and cheese mixture onto the center of each tortilla. Be careful not to overfill, as this can make rolling difficult. A good rule of thumb is to keep the filling in a line down the center.

  • Step 4: Add toppings

    On top of the filling, add salsa, sour cream, shredded lettuce, and sliced avocado. Feel free to customize these toppings based on your preferences. Consider adding jalapeños for spice or corn for sweetness.

  • Step 5: Roll the burrito

    Fold in the sides of the tortilla over the filling, then roll from the bottom up to close the burrito. Make sure to roll it tightly to avoid any fillings spilling out. If you're having trouble, you can secure the burrito with a toothpick.

  • Step 6: Serve and enjoy

    Serve immediately with extra salsa or your favorite dipping sauces like guacamole or queso. Enjoy your delicious homemade burritos!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare my ingredients before cooking?

Start by washing your vegetables, like lettuce and avocado. For the avocado, cut it in half, remove the pit, and slice it. Shredding cheese can be done using a box grater or buying pre-shredded cheese to save time.

What if I can't find certain ingredients?

No worries! Burritos are versatile. You can substitute black beans with pinto beans or lentils, and any protein can be swapped for what you have on hand, like tofu or ground turkey.

How do I know when my tortillas are warm enough?

Warm tortillas for about 30 seconds on each side in a skillet over low heat until they are soft and pliable. You can also check by feeling them; they should feel warm to the touch.

What is the best way to fold a burrito?

After placing your fillings on the tortilla, fold in the sides first to contain the fillings, then roll from the bottom up tightly. This helps keep everything inside.

How do I store leftover burritos?

Wrap leftover burritos tightly in plastic wrap or foil, and keep them in the fridge for up to 3 days. You can also freeze them for longer storage.

Is it safe to handle raw chicken or beef?

Yes, but remember to practice good kitchen safety! Always wash your hands before and after handling raw meat, and use separate cutting boards for meat and vegetables to avoid cross-contamination.

How can I add flavor to my burrito?

Experiment with spices! Adding cumin, chili powder, or garlic powder to your bean mixture will enhance the flavor. Fresh herbs like cilantro can also add a nice touch.

Can I make burritos ahead of time?

Absolutely! You can prepare the fillings in advance and store them in the fridge. Just assemble and heat the tortillas when you’re ready to serve.

What if my burrito falls apart when I try to eat it?

It’s all about the folding technique! Make sure you don’t overfill the burrito and fold it tightly. If it still falls apart, don’t worry; you can always eat it with a fork!

How can I make my burrito healthier?

Use whole grain tortillas, add more veggies like bell peppers or corn, and opt for low-fat cheese or Greek yogurt instead of regular sour cream.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a vegetarian option, you can omit the chicken or beef and add roasted vegetables or additional beans. To make it gluten-free, use corn tortillas instead of flour tortillas. For a dairy-free version, substitute the cheese with a plant-based cheese or simply omit it, and use a dairy-free sour cream alternative.

Pairings

For a refreshing drink, pair the burritos with a zesty limeade or a light Mexican lager such as Corona or Modelo. If you prefer a non-alcoholic option, try a sparkling water with a splash of lime. For sides, consider serving tortilla chips with guacamole or a side of Mexican street corn (elote) for a complete meal.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the burritos on a large platter for a casual family-style meal. Garnish with fresh cilantro and lime wedges for a pop of color and added flavor. Offer a variety of dipping sauces, such as extra salsa, hot sauce, or a creamy chipotle sauce, to enhance the dining experience. If hosting a gathering, consider setting up a burrito bar, allowing guests to customize their burritos with different toppings.

#

Easy Burrito

15 min
$10
450 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

Dairy

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianHigh Protein

Cuisine:

Mexican

Course:

Main CourseLunch

Tags:

QuickEasyHealthyMexican

Description

A quick and satisfying burrito filled with beans, cheese, and your choice of protein, all wrapped in a soft tortilla.

Ingredients

  • tortilla: 4 large
  • canned black beans: 1 can (15 oz)
  • shredded cheese: 1 cup
  • cooked chicken or beef (optional): 1 cup
  • salsa: 1/2 cup
  • sour cream (optional): 1/2 cup
  • lettuce (optional): 1 cup shredded
  • avocado (optional): 1 sliced

Date Created:

11/18/2024
